newsitem.title: USA: PS New Hampshire sees 125 MW unit up today.
newsitem.headline: PS New Hampshire sees 125 MW unit up today.

text.p: Public Service of New Hampshire (PSNH) said Friday it expected a 125 megawatt (MW) unit at its coal-fired Merrimack power station to be back on line later today, ending an eight-week maintenance outage.
"They're starting it right now. We'll be making electricity tonight," said a company spokesman, adding the unit, called Merrimack 1, was returning about two days earlier than scheduled.
PSNH will shut the 355 MW Merrimack unit 2 today for about four weeks for boiler maintenance, he said.
The Merrimack facility, near the town of Bow in central New Hampshire, produces 23 percent of the utility's power output.
Public Service of New Hampshire is a subsidary of Northeast Utilities.
